column4: I can't run Nautilus as a regular user on my system, but I can under sudo. Any reason why that would be the case?
did you change the permissions somehow?
Not that I know of. The only reason it occured to me to run it as root was b/c I saw this bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/nautilus/+bug/421059
I was running kubuntu, and then after I upgraded to karmic I decided to run gnome. I haven't been able to run nautilus since I made the switch. Never ran it before, just used Dolphin.
